result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas G. Becker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CM58, 15CF102, 15CF116 called together at 11:05am [mo]
Defendant Douglas G. Becker in court, in cusotdy with Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of " GUILTY  " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CF116 and Count #1 of Case 15CM58; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Becker   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts of Case 15CF116 and 15CM58 
On Motion of the State, the Court outright dismisses: Case 15CF102

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Becker 

On Case 15CM58, Count #1:
The Court sentences Mr. Becker to 9 months in the county jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system, this sentence is to be served consecutive to the to the sentence in Milwaukee County case 11CF4948
The Court orders civil judgment be entered on the costs/fees/assessments; to include $33 in subpoena fees

On Case 15CF116, Count #1:
The Court sentences Mr. Becker  to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  3 years.  This sentence to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM58

On Case 15CF116, Count #2:
The Court sentences Mr. Becker  to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  3 years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1 of Case 15CF116, but consecutive to the sentence in 15CM58.


The Court finds that the Defendant is  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no contact with Jaclyn Pardue
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling  as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay drug testing fee in the amount of $75 (15CF116) and $25(15CF102)
--to pay buy money reimbursement in the amount of $420 (15CF116)
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $33 (15CF116)
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand


The Court orders outright:
--6 months drivers license supsension on each count of 15CF116, to be served consecutive to each other 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:40am

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2016 at 08:20 am.

Stipulation and Order for Withdrawal of Attorney

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #15CF102, #15CF116 and #15CM58 called at 12:15pm. 
Defendant Douglas G. Becker  appears via videoconferencing from Oshkosh Correctional Institution, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Jon Wilsnack, appears in court.  ADA  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Wilsnack submits a signed Stipulation and proposed Order Withdrawl of Attorney.  
After the Court verifies with Mr. Becker that he is in agreement with the Motion, the Court signs the Stipulation as its Order, allowing Attorney Wilsnack to withdraw as counsel.
The Court and parties discuss that the Court will maintain the currently scheduled 5/31/16 FSSC and Status date.  After Mr. Becker expresses concern about there being sufficent time to prepare for the scheduled Jury Trial date, the Court indicates that to Mr. Becker that his newly-appointed PD attorney will address any concerns with this. 
recess 12:19pm.    

[Clerk's added post-hearing note:  upon further review, it is realized that these cases are also scheduled on May 6th, with case #15CF116 set for Preliminary Hearing on that date. The clerk refers this issue to the JA for consideration of rescheduling the Preliminary Hearing in Case #16CF116 to 5/31/16 or a different date, and removing the May 6th status on the other cases.]


NEXT: (1) Attorney Wilsnack will contact the Jefferson PD Office to arrange for the appointment of successor counsel  (2) JA- see post hearing note regarding May 6th scheduling concern  (3) the cases all remain scheduled on 5/31/16 for FSSC and Status Conference  (4) Case #15CF102 remains on the Court's calendar for Jury Trial on 6/6-6/7/16 at 8:30am.
Motion hearing on April 25, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Attorney Wilsnack

Cases 15CF102, 15CF116 and 15CM58  called at 2:34pm [mo]
Defendant Douglas G. Becker appears via video conferencing from DCI, in custody. Attorney John Vernon Rhiel appears in the courtroom.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Rhiel indicates that he may have a conflict with the CF files should they proceed to trial, if a resolution would be met then there would be no conflict.
Mr. Becker does not want to waive the conflict.

Atty. Rhiel indicates that he will promptly withdraw so that sucessor counsel can be appointed by the PD office. 

The Court finds that Mr. Becker continues to be indigent and sucessor Public Defender should be appointed for all three cases.
Mr. Becker indicates that he will most likely be transferred to a different institution within a week. 
--Sucessor Counsel is to notify the Court as to which institution Mr. Becker is at, so that video conferencing can be arranged 

recess: 2:40pm
NEXT: STC: 9/24/2015 at 1:30pm(by Video, sucessor Counsel to notify Court which institute Mr. Becker is at)

Cases 15CF102, 15CF116 and 15CM58 called together at 11:03am
Defendant Douglas G. Becker appears via videoconferencing from WPS, in custody. His attorney, John Vernon Rhiel appears in court.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case 15CF116(Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia
--take a prescriptions as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offenders (this only applies if Mr. Becker is released from custody)
--no acts or threats of violence
 toward any person
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 


As to Cases 15CM58 and 15CF102: Atty. Rhiel indicates there will likely be a global resolution of all three cases. 
recess: 11:15am

Cases 14CT406, 15CF102 and 15CM58 called at 1:19pm [mo]
Defendant Douglas G. Becker appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody with Attorney Yalena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel), with 
Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Zarwell indicates that Public Defender will appoint counsel. 

Case 14CT406 is resolved by the Court signing of the Disposition Stipulation 
The Court verifies Mr. Becker's 1328 W. Main St, Watertown address. 

As to Case 15CM58:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial demanded by the Defendant

As to Case 15CM58 
The Court requires a $1500 cash bond, with conditions:
--No discussion of the case with Kristopher Bauer OR Devin Sisler
--Booking at Jefferson Co. Sheriff's Department 

As to Case 15CF102: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Defense Waives the 10 day time limit up until 4/24/15 

As to Case 15CF102 The requires a $1500 cash bond, with conditions. In response to the Clerk's inquiry, the Court clarifies that it is setting 2 seperate bonds in these cases, however it is only requiring a single payment of $1500 cash. 
--no possession of controlled substances without prescription
--no possession of drug paraphenalia
--no contact with Jaclyn Pardue
